item.title: From Boltzmann to Shannon
item.description: In his key paper in 1865, Clausius defined entropy as this thermodynamic quantity and showed from empirical observations of engine inefficiencies and heat conduction that it seemed to maximize in isolated system. Almost a decade later, Boltzmann came up with his famous equation defining entropy as a measure of the number of accessible states.
